doc.after: The Zong massacre was the mass murder of an estimated 132â142Â enslaved Africans by the crew of the slave ship Zong in the days following 29Â November 1781.[note 1] The ship was owned by the Gregson slave-trading syndicate, based in Liverpool, which participated in the Atlantic slave trade. As was common business practice, they had taken out insurance on the lives of the slaves as cargo. When the ship ran low on potable water following navigational mistakes, the crew threw slaves overboard into the sea to drown, in order that the remainder could survive.
